channel.description: Recent content in XO Communications on 0x000216

item.title: Buy Convergence By The Byte
item.description:
XO Communications is revolutionizing telecommunications by offering IP Network services priced by bandwidth usage instead of traditional lines or channels. This shift to an IP-based network and the use of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) for telephone trunking are rendering traditional telephony services obsolete. By utilizing a packet-switched network and transmitting everything in packet protocol, voice, and data traffic can easily share a single circuit. The concept of convergence, using one network for voice, video, and data, has gained traction with IT departments aiming to simplify network management and executives seeking cost reductions...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/buy-convergence-by-the-byte/

item.title: XO Communications Nears Tbps National Network
item.description:
Any lingering doubts about the supposed overabundance of bandwidth in the late ’90s telecom boom should be dispelled by XO Communications’ recent announcement. Despite upgrading their national backbone just last year, XO is increasing its capacity again. This upgrade will boost major coast-to-coast network routes from 400 Gbps to a staggering 800 Gbps, putting them within reach of terabit-per-second speeds. This massive capacity increase is driven by a fivefold surge in demand for high-capacity inter-city network services over the past year, according to XO...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/xo-communications-nears-tbps-national-network/

item.title: E911 For Enterprise VoIP
item.description:
The transition from traditional phone lines to internet-based calling has brought about some unexpected issues, particularly with emergency services. We often take 911 for granted, assuming help will always be on the way. However, this isn’t always the case with internet-based phone systems. Imagine a scenario where a fire breaks out in your office. You dial 911, report the emergency, and evacuate. However, the fire department ends up at your company’s headquarters instead of your current location...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/e911-for-enterprise-voip/

item.title: XO Nails Down SIP Trunking Savings
item.description:
Want to discover how your business could save upwards of $88,000 annually just by switching to SIP trunking service? Hold on a minute! To achieve this level of savings, your business needs to have a certain volume of operations and spending. This figure comes from XO Communications, a leading voice and data carrier, and their new Enterprise SIP Savings Estimator. So, what kind of business can expect these substantial savings? In this scenario, a company with 1,000 employees spread across 10 locations, where half of their phone calls are internal...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/xo-nails-down-sip-trunking-savings/

item.title: 100 GigE in the Long Run
item.description:
As internet and private network users demand increasingly higher bandwidth, long-haul fiber optic networks, including those used by regional and national carriers, are being upgraded to accommodate this growth. The current standard is 40 Gbps, but companies like XO Communications and Infinera are pushing boundaries by showcasing 100 Gigabit Ethernet on XO’s long-haul DWDM network. This partnership addresses two key requirements: a high-capacity long-haul network and equipment capable of utilizing that capacity...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/100-gige-in-the-long-run/

item.title: Do You Need Bandwidth on Demand?
item.description:
By: John Shepler When subscribing to bandwidth, you’re usually expected to understand your network’s needs and pick the optimal service. But what if your needs are unclear or fluctuate? What about transitioning from in-house IT to cloud-based services? What are the consequences of an incorrect choice? Traditional Bandwidth Services Fall Short Conventional line contracts offer fixed bandwidth for a predetermined period, like a DS3 connection providing 45 Mbps constantly. While this guarantees consistent speed, you pay even when it’s idle...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/do-you-need-bandwidth-on-demand/

item.title: What XO’s 1,000,000 VoIP Customers Predicts
item.description:
XO Communications, a leading competitor in the telecom industry, recently celebrated a significant achievement: reaching one million business VoIP users. Reaching this milestone in just five years surprised even XO. This rapid adoption might be unexpected for those hesitant about embracing VoIP technology. We’ve all experienced the downsides of poorly implemented VoIP – distortion, dropped calls, and poor sound quality. However, successful implementations demonstrate that these issues are avoidable. After all, a million businesses can’t be wrong...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/what-xo-s-1-000-000-voip-customers-predicts/

item.title: Ethernet over Copper Growing By Leaps and Bounds
item.description:
The hottest new access network service is Ethernet over Copper (EoC), with competitive carriers rushing to expand coverage. What makes EoC so popular? It stems from evolving network needs. Wide Area Networks (WANs) have been dominated by the telephone industry, adapting phone technology for data and video transmission. T1 lines, using two pairs of copper telephone wires, have been the standard for businesses needing dedicated Ethernet connections. They offer 1.5 Mbps upload and download speeds...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-over-copper-growing-by-leaps-and-bounds/

item.title: How MPLS Network Bursting Provides Flexibility
item.description:
The standard method of ordering bandwidth for last-mile connections or MPLS networks involves committing to a specific rate or line speed. For instance, a T1 line provides a constant 1.5 Mbps, while a 10 Mbps Ethernet service delivers precisely that speed. In multi-tenant networks like MPLS VPNs, you purchase a committed information rate representing the maximum speed your connection will achieve. However, what happens if business needs change or your initial estimate is inaccurate?..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-mpls-network-bursting-provides-flexibility/

item.title: Contact Center On Demand in the Cloud
item.description:
The sophistication of cloud communications services is constantly increasing, representing a logical progression in the cloud computing revolution. With data servers already transitioned to the cloud, numerous businesses are questioning the necessity of maintaining costly and aging PBX phone systems. Transitioning business phone systems to the cloud is becoming increasingly practical. Beginning with Hosted VoIP or Hosted PBX, this shift eliminates the need for substantial hardware and traditional phone lines. Instead, handsets connect to the company network and a high-bandwidth WAN connection links to the provider...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/contact-center-on-demand-in-the-cloud/

item.title: Fiber Optic Speed Using Ethernet over Copper
item.description:
Fiber optic communication lines are expected to be the future of connectivity, with major companies already utilizing their fiber infrastructure. While smaller companies with high bandwidth requirements have transitioned to fiber, the lack of availability in certain areas poses a challenge. Traditionally, T1 lines, offering 1.5 Mbps speed, were the go-to solution due to their widespread availability and affordability. However, with the increasing bandwidth demands of modern businesses, the limitations of T1 lines have become apparent...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fiber-optic-speed-using-ethernet-over-copper/
